alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND RIPLEY COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 120 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Greensburg, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Versailles, Milan, Osgood, Sunman, Holton, Napoleon, Millhousen, Rexville, Huntersville, Benham, Ballstown, Penntown, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, New Marion, Friendship, Versailles Lake, Cross Plains, Otter Village and Olean. This includes I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 145 and 147, and between mile markers 149 and 157. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
